name: places/ChIJNyFAat1YwokRe9y05CWG4p8
formattedAddress: 500 E 62nd St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 500 E 62nd St, New York, NY 10065, USA

editorialSummary.text: Chic property with a lobby bar, penthouse restaurant offering kosher dining & modern rooms.

originalText.text: Front desk staff very pleasant and helpful. My room key only worked 1 out of 3 times I attempted to enter the room and required multiple trips back down to the front desk to have staff let me in the room.  This was happening to others as well.  The room itself had worn out furniture and a bathroom in desperate need of fresh caulking.  Parking was located below the building, but unfortunately the parking staff there was rather rude.  Not the worse place to stay, but I'm sure there are other locations in the area to spend your money that are better maintained/updated.

originalText.text:
I would leave 1 star but the staff is very friendly and attentive.
They do with what they have. Hotel online photos must have been from the old days. Seems like whoever runs/owns this hotel gave up on keeping up with it back in the early 2000s. Very rundown.
First room was so hot. We got moved. Both rooms had very very dirty carpet. Super thin walls; sleeping is hard as it feels like people next door are literally in your room.

originalText.text: Staff is friendly but thats all I can pretty much compliment about this place. The carpet is super dirty, sheets feel dirty, the pictures are misleading, well at least for me, my room had a view of a construction site and one morning i woke up the the workers looking into my room window. The hotel is very far from any subway line and you will have to walk a mile just to catch a subway, food in the area is delicious though. Overall I wouldn’t stay here again, unless it was my only option. There is plenty of other options for better prices.

originalText.text: Terrible!!! We spent 500$ for a freezing room. We called the front desk 3 times through the night to fix the heating system. In the end, they have us 2 small heaters that didn’t even work. We called twice and they kept sending us broken heaters. On the third time they sent us another 2 heaters and only one of them worked. The next day we asked to be switched and they stated that they were completely booked. They offered us 2 drinks at the bar and a discount would be applied. The next night was even colder and that little heater did nothing. We couldn’t even enjoy the view because we were bundled up so tight in the blankets they brought us. Completely ruined what was our make up Valentine’s Day since we were both working doubles the entire week. It was a waste of it hard earned money. On top of that, the manger never applied the discount so we payed full price plus other charges that were supposed to be wavied. What made it worst is when I called to complain, the customer service rep stated that the hotel never filled my compliant. They saw that multiple heaters were requested but there was no compliant on file that we did not enjoy our stay. Well, it’s zero below outside, maintenance couldn’t fix the heating system, multiple heaters were sent and returned due to them being broke. I can assume that we as guests did not expect to pay 500$ over the course of two days to play a game of who will freeze to death first. In theory using body heat to keep warm may sound romantic but not in a room with no heat in the middle of the coldest month in NYC.

originalText.text: I went to this hotel due to it's close proximity to the Sloan Kettering hospital across the street. It's was clean and comfortable and the service desk employees were just wonderful. The view of the bridge and river next to us and the skyline at night were spectacular. If you need to spend a night or two in the city this is a very nice hotel if you are looking to go and see a play or go to a museum. Will stay again if I'm in this area. Loved the hotel employees they were more than accommodating.
